title: Supporting not the best team
body:
Hiya, so this is my second discussion and thanks to everyone who helped me in my first discussion. 

Anyways, I'm a Jungle main and since I'll need a second role when I'm ready for Ranked I've gone support since I find it easy to do and I'm good at it. 

Problem is though, majority of my support games I lose, why? Well I feel as though it's cause at least 1-3 members on my team aren't pulling their weight ingame. 

Recently, I went Taric support with a Vayne who kept on either running away or engaging at the wrong moment, as well as an Ivern top who kept on feeding. (Cred to both for not blaming or flaming anyone tho). 

Since I was support though, I felt pretty powerless to turn the tide of the game, I could get picks for my team but nothing alone which is my problem. 

So is there anyway I could carry as a support or any support champ for that matter? Thx

As a Support main i Totally get where youre coming, before picking i usually have a peak at our ADC's history and sort of play how he/she will play for eg, If they are decent adc (8 wins/ 12) i would push more to be a my normal supports , Nami, Thresh etc etc 

If i see a guy playing Lucian first time in ranked or see that he has quite a few losses with that particular champion i would go with Annie, Morgana, Sona, Where i can support but have a back up carry incase thinsg go south, Trust me they always do, In situations like that you wanna get wards and Rush ROA and go AP/Tank

 and probably recommend {{summoner:14}} instead of {{summoner:3}} incase adc misses 100 HP, Ignite can do its thangg, However if you prefer your own over the other up to you, (NOTE: YOU ALWAYS WANT TO PLAY WHAT YOU'RE COMFORTABLE WITH, AGAIN DONT TAKE ANYONES WORD THAT THIS WILL WORK 100% THIS IS JUST MY OPINION)

Ideally you need to be back up as well as helping ADC get fed and helping team, Pretty much played Bard Support to get me out of Silver with very similar build, I gave alot of kills and got some myself to sustain incase my ADC died 

But again this is only if you feel like your adc is bad if you look at stats, Generally in Gold ive seen players do pretty well so i play my standard Supports, Thresh, Nami etc 

At the end of the day play who ever YOU'RE comfortable with and try your best to do your part as best you can, The ideal thing is to get your ADC Fed and your team covered try gank Mid when you can as well to give your mid laner advantages and yeah pretty much it 

Good Luck :D  {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

I enjoy playing support the most, but can play all roles at a very high level.

You're right, support is the hardest role to turn around a game if it's going south. A good support will really augment a good ADC's - or good team for that matter - effectiveness. However, little can be done if your carries are gronks. No matter how well you ward, no matter how well you did in lane, no matter how hard you try to prevent bad situation, if the team insists on chasing past ward lines, gets too far behind during early stage, don't ward themselves, et cetera, not much can be done.

'Tis the life of a support, I'm afraid.

Don't play Taric then. He is literally useless as a laner (without voice comms).
For solo que you either want easy champions or playmakers (or both).

If you like Taric, play Braum or Leona.
As a support, roaming becomes very important. Go with your jungler and gank a lane together, it almost always results in a  kill. It also usually makes that laner rage at your bot lane for not calling MIA and you can win the psychological battle.

To be a good support, its mainly about your decision making really. I find that supports and junglers are more about decision making and game knowledge than any other role (since you have so much "free time").

----------------------------------------------------

After looking you up: http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=shuddervolt

Your builds as a support are expensive and not necessary. Don't build {{item:3065}}  instead build {{item:3190}} . Half your support games you don't even buy sightstone or upgrade your sweeper.
Half your games in general you don't remember to buy boots.

You are still using tier 2 runes. You take deathfire touch on almost everyone.

I'm sorry friend, but you are not ready for ranked imo. Study more, watch streams, youtubers, pro players etc. Learn the game and don't jump into ranked because you will be put into bronze. Better to learn how to play before you mess up your MMR then try to fix it after your learnt.

I am only B1 so I don't really have any qualifications to say anything, but I found that picking supports that can be built to carry helps a lot. Morg is my favourite example. Starting with a Spell-thief's gives you some mana regen and gold income, and after a SS and Frost Queen's, it is quite easy and viable to build AP and be a secondary APC. Her kit also compounds this with great CC and a shield, so even if you don't carry and build support, you can still make game-making picks.

At lower ELO's, I heard Lux works well too, but drops after Gold or so. Zyra I imagine is good too. Sona is a god atm

I get what your saying there.

The disadvantage to being a support is the reliance on your teammates, namely your ADC early game. When I play ADC I nearly always play passive aggressive.

So if I see my opening, i'll ping then go in and initiate the fight. 

Problem is some ADC's won't take the hint at that crucial moment. 
So the key is to always stay with the ADC, let him/her do some damage to minions/champs, then as the enemies take damage, I would take the opportunity for example to land a pull or hook (Thresh and Blitz) landing a kill (Or double)for the ADC.

I'm not overly skilled with Braum, however the slows he has is amazing, use that to your advantage. 

Hope I helped, I'm actually in the process of making an ADC and Sup Tutorial if your interested.

If you're getting picks for your team you're doing your job, you're not realistically going to be able to win any 1v1 as support though. Once you get a pick you and the team need to look at what objective can we get as a result of getting the pick. If no objective is available then set up vision and clear out enemy vision.

Also think about itemisation in the vayne game mikaels could've helped against brand and naut cc. Get vision around objectives and control that vision and you're doing a huge part in turning the tide of the game.

As for champs Ali can be a huge playmaker, thresh and the use of lantern, Sion hugely tanky, Sona a lot of poke ult can change a team fight very squishy though so,positioning is important.
